info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:39AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Rogers, southeastern Osage, north central Creek, southwestern Washington, southeastern Pawnee and northern Tulsa Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 739 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Avant to 2 miles northeast of Hallett. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Skiatook... Collinsville... Cleveland... Mannford... Sperry... Oologah... Westport... Vera... Osage... Hallett... Terlton... Walnut Creek State Park... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
